dt: {bc}to impart or suggest in an artful or indirect way {bc}{sx|imply||}
{bc}to introduce (something, such as an idea) gradually or in a subtle, indirect, or covert way
{bc}to introduce (someone, such as oneself) by stealthy, smooth, or artful means

pt: {sc}introduce{/sc} {sc}insert{/sc} {sc}insinuate{/sc} {sc}interpolate{/sc} {sc}intercalate{/sc} {sc}interpose{/sc} {sc}interject{/sc} mean to put between or among others. {sc}introduce{/sc} is a general term for bringing or placing a thing or person into a group or body already in existence.

pt.t: {it}introduced{/it} a new topic into the conversation

pt: {sc}insert{/sc} implies putting into a fixed or open space between or among.
{sc}insinuate{/sc} implies introducing gradually or by gentle pressure.
{sc}interpolate{/sc} applies to the inserting of something extraneous or spurious.

pt.t: {it}interpolated{/it} her own comments into the report

pt: {sc}intercalate{/sc} suggests an intrusive inserting of something in an existing series or sequence.
{sc}interpose{/sc} suggests inserting an obstruction or cause of delay.
{sc}interject{/sc} implies an abrupt or forced introduction.

{sc}suggest{/sc} {sc}imply{/sc} {sc}hint{/sc} {sc}intimate{/sc} {sc}insinuate{/sc} mean to convey an idea indirectly. {sc}suggest{/sc} may stress putting into the mind by association of ideas, awakening of a desire, or initiating a train of thought.

pt.t: a film title that {it}suggests{/it} its subject matter

pt: {sc}imply{/sc} is close to {sc}suggest{/sc} but may indicate a more definite or logical relation of the unexpressed idea to the expressed.
{sc}hint{/sc} implies the use of slight or remote suggestion with a minimum of overt statement.

pt.t: {it}hinted{/it} that she might get the job

pt: {sc}intimate{/sc} stresses delicacy of suggestion without connoting any lack of candor.

pt.t: {it}intimates{/it} that there is more to the situation than meets the eye

pt: {sc}insinuate{/sc} applies to the conveying of a usually unpleasant idea in a sly underhanded manner.

et: Latin {it}insinuatus{/it}, past participle of {it}insinuare{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}sinuare{/it} to bend, curve, from {it}sinus{/it} curve
shortdef: to impart or suggest in an artful or indirect way : imply
to introduce (something, such as an idea) gradually or in a subtle, indirect, or covert way
to introduce (someone, such as oneself) by stealthy, smooth, or artful means
